content:
Diagnosis:		Pituitary prolactinoma

Management:		Cabergoline commenced March 2023

Histology:		Microprolactinoma (6mm), Ki-67 < 1%, p53 negative

Current Situation:	Review at 12 months of medical therapy

[redacted name] was reviewed in the endocrine-oncology clinic today. Her prolactin has normalized from initial level of 2500 mIU/L to 280 mIU/L on cabergoline 0.5mg twice weekly. She reports good medication compliance despite occasional mild nausea. Visual fields remain normal. Recent pituitary MRI (15/03/2024) shows reduction in adenoma size from 6mm to 3mm. Regular menstrual cycles have resumed. The plan is to continue current cabergoline dose with biochemical monitoring in 3 months and repeat MRI in 6 months. She will be reviewed in clinic following the next MRI scan.

cancer_timeline.value: MRI shows reduction in adenoma size from 6mm to 3mm

status_updates.value: Microprolactinoma showing good response to medical therapy with normalized prolactin and tumor shrinkage
Biochemical monitoring in 3 months and repeat MRI in 6 months
Review in clinic following next MRI scan
